meanings.definition: Not poor; having enough money or resources to meet basic needs.
meanings.sent1: The nonpoor family could afford to buy new clothes for their children.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved knowing she was nonpoor and could pay her bills on time.
meanings.sent3: The nonpoor squirrel saved up enough nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The nonpoor garden bloomed with colorful flowers all season long.
meanings.sent5: Living in a nonpoor neighborhood meant having well-maintained streets and parks.

meanings.definition: A person who is not living in poverty.
meanings.sent1: The nonpoor in the community volunteered to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: Being nonpoor allowed him to focus on his education without financial worries.
meanings.sent3: The nonpoor at the charity event donated generously to support the cause.
meanings.sent4: She admired the nonpoor for their resilience and willingness to help others.
meanings.sent5: The nonpoor were grateful for the opportunities they had to improve their lives.
